intro: Anadendrum muluensis, commonly known as the Mulu hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and red. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Its foliage is broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
